title: test(e2e): add e2e tests for investor entities
description: ref #911 - Verify display of investor entity details with shares and option grants - Ensure empty states render correctly when no holdings exist - Confirm access for admins and lawyers, and restriction for regular users > [!NOTE] > AI assistance was used in preparing this PR: > - **Cursor Pro (GPT-5)**: for code scaffolding and refactoring suggestions > - **Claude Sonnet 4**: for explanation drafts and wording improvements
author: Anshgrover23

title: replace CSS-only breakpoints with `isMobile` in `TableSkeleton`
description: ref: #1132 * Uses the `useIsMobile` hook to render only the layout that’s actually needed, instead of keeping both mobile and desktop skeletons rendered at once. * Avoids rendering hidden `` elements altogether (the root cause of the Playwright strict mode error in `e2e/tests/company/invoices/one-off-payments.spec.ts`). * Keeps the component logic cleaner and easier to understand. * Makes the component easier to maintain in the long term. * Reduces flakiness in tests going forward. > [!NOTE] > AI assistance was used in preparing this PR: > - **Cursor Pro (GPT-5)**: for code scaffolding and refactoring suggestions > - **Claude Sonnet 4**: for explanation drafts and wording improvements
author: Anshgrover23

title: feat(company_updates): migrate frontend db calls to Rails API
description: ref: #911 - Replace direct DB access with Rails API calls - Remove `checkHasInvestors` guard as authorization is handled by backend > [!NOTE] > AI assistance was used in preparing this PR: > - **Cursor Pro (GPT-5)**: for code scaffolding and refactoring suggestions > - **Claude Sonnet 4**: for explanation drafts and wording improvements
author: Anshgrover23

title: feat: create option pools via UI

This modification ensures consistency in the rails backend, improves API semantics, and removes ambiguity. --- ref: #911 > [!NOTE] > AI assistance was used in preparing this PR: > - **Cursor Pro (GPT-5)**: for code scaffolding and refactoring suggestions > - **Claude Sonnet 4**: for explanation drafts and wording improvements

title: Enable CI to run automatically on contributor pull requests

author: Anshgrover23

title: feat(equity-settings): require company name before enabling equity
description: ref #911 | Before | After | |--------|-------| | | # Before # After * Several backend equity flows assume `company.name` is present: * `EquityGrantCreation#next_grant_name` uses `company.name.first(3)` when generating grant names. * `EquityExercisingService#next_share_name` uses `company.name.first(1)` for share holdings. * `GenerateTaxFormService` embeds `company.name.parameterize` into document filenames. * Triggering these flows without a company name would cause runtime errors. * The guardrail ensures admins cannot proceed until the required company metadata is set. * Matches the existing **fade + disable UX** used (e.g., invoice creation without legal details). > [!NOTE] > AI assistance was used in preparing this PR: > - **Cursor Pro (GPT-5)**: for code scaffolding and refactoring suggestions > - **Claude Sonnet 4**: for explanation drafts and wording improvements
author: Anshgrover23

title: feat: cap table UI

title: Refactor InviteLawyer service to improve user invitation logic
description: # Before: Would reject any user who already existed in the database of any company. https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d7295e57-dc4e-4ce3-9c35-39655132654b https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ac282036-4f46-4b81-a2ac-c587b8d8bd3c # After: Only rejects users who are already lawyers in the company https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9057f222-6b1d-44fa-a84d-6165b278493a ref #911 > [!NOTE] > AI assistance was used in preparing this PR: > - **Cursor Pro (GPT-5)**: for code scaffolding and refactoring suggestions > - **Claude Sonnet 4**: for explanation drafts and wording improvements
author: Anshgrover23

title: Remove expenses feature flag and related checks
description: ref: #911 ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **Refactor** * Expenses are now always available across the app; the previous feature flag is removed. * Invoice editing relies only on expense categories; no “enabled” state is shown. * **Chores** * Seed data and templates updated to always include expense categories by default.
author: Anshgrover23

title: tech debt: removed unnecessary console logs
author: Anshgrover23

title: Add e2e tests for invoice editing and rejection workflows
description: ref: #911 - Added `edit.spec.ts` to verify invoice editing preserves and updates fields correctly - Added `rejection-flow.spec.ts` to cover full rejection workflow: - Contractor creates invoice → Admin rejects with reason - Contractor views rejection, edits invoice, and re-submits - Admin sees corrected invoice awaiting approval - Ensures UI reflects proper states and DB is updated accordingly ## Summary by CodeRabbit - **Tests** - Added end-to-end coverage for editing invoices, ensuring form fields are preserved on edit, totals recalculate correctly, and notes persist after updates. - Added a full rejection-and-edit workflow: contractor submission, admin rejection with reason, contractor revisions with pre-filled fields, resubmission back to “Awaiting approval,” correct amount recalculation, and removal of the rejection reason upon update. - Includes cross-checks that updated notes persist while invoice numbers remain unchanged.
author: Anshgrover23

title: refactor: remove unused functions to improve product quality and reduce friction
description: ref: #930 ref: #584 ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **Tests** * Removed legacy end-to-end helpers and rewrote E2E specs to use direct, inlined interactions and selectors. * Simplified network handling by removing explicit network emulation/reset steps and reliance on network-idle waits. * General cleanup for leaner, more localized tests and faster CI runs. * No changes to user-facing features or production behavior.
author: Anshgrover23

title: Remove encrypted fields from database schema and related logic
description: Fixes #824 ## Summary by CodeRabbit - Refactor - Removed several legacy encrypted columns from multiple database tables, simplifying the schema. - Chores - Removed obsolete encryption utilities and references; added a migration entry to update the database. - Tests - Deleted tests tied to the removed encrypted fields. User-facing behavior unchanged; maintenance, storage, and query overhead may be slightly improved.
author: Anshgrover23

title: Remove QuickBooks feature flag checks from backend and frontend
description: Always render QuickBooks integration card, removing conditional flag check fixes #906 ref: #911 All ruby tests passing. ## Summary by CodeRabbit - New Features - The Integrations section in Administrator Settings is now always visible to administrators. - QuickBooks integration is now generally available and no longer gated by a feature flag. - Users will see the QuickBooks integration consistently across companies where applicable. - No changes to other integrations or permissions; existing functionality remains the same.
author: Anshgrover23

title: chore: clean up unused dependencies & reduce tech debt
author: Anshgrover23

title: feat: Manage lawyers via UI
description: Fixes #679 [video.webm](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a4905eca-dbd1-4fdd-958d-ae3b11cc6c1c) ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * Roles page to manage admins and lawyers, invite by email, and add/remove roles (combined roles view). * **Improvements** * Unified role workflows, improved autocomplete input, per-column table styling, and optional combo-box search. * **Removals** * Invite Lawyer action removed from Documents and legacy Administrators page; company-level lawyers toggle removed. * **Bug Fixes** * Prevents removing the last admin or your own admin role; clearer validation/error feedback. * **Tests** * Added unit, controller, mailer, and end-to-end tests for role management and invitations. * **Chores** * DB: removed lawyers flag, added signup-invite tracking; added invitation email and related routes.
author: Anshgrover23

title: Refactor: replace encrypted fields with plaintext columns in database schema
description: ## Summary: replace encrypted fields with plaintext columns in database schema - Updated database schema to replace encrypted fields with plaintext columns for conversations, messages, tools, and Gmail support emails. - Removed references to the now obsolete ENCRYPT_COLUMN_SECRET and adjusted related logic to utilize HASH_WORDS_SECRET. - Cleaned up API and data handling to ensure compatibility with the new schema. - Updated environment configuration and test setups accordingly. Ref: #824 ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * Vault-backed secret management with caching for runtime secret retrieval. * **Refactor** * Switched several formerly duplicated/encrypted fields to plaintext primary storage. * Converted related flows to asynchronous secret retrieval. * **Bug Fixes** * Removed redundant plaintext synchronization to prevent stale/duplicate values. * **Chores** * Removed obsolete migration script and a secret-generator UI component. * Updated test factories and test setup to match schema changes. * **Documentation** * Deployment docs updated to reflect environment variable changes. * **Tests** * Added tests for secret management behaviors.
author: Anshgrover23

title: fix(e2e): mock FIRECRAWL_API_KEY in CI & improve accessibility selectors
description: - Added missing `FIRECRAWL_API_KEY` to CI env to fix failing E2E runs caused by a dynamic component requiring it. - Updated `WebsiteCrawlSetting` to use semantic roles and aria labels, improving accessibility and making Playwright tests more robust by using `getByRole` instead of CSS selectors. ref: #584 ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **Accessibility** * Improved accessibility in the website list by adding ARIA roles and labels for better screen reader support. * **Tests** * Updated end-to-end tests to use more semantic, accessible role-based selectors for improved reliability and alignment with accessibility best practices. * **Chores** * Updated environment variables in the end-to-end testing workflow configuration.
author: Anshgrover23

title: fix: E2E tests and remove page object from newMessageWithsavedRepliesPage
description: ref: #584 ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **Tests** * Improved end-to-end tests for saved replies in conversations by making UI interactions more robust and reliable. * Enhanced test setup and error handling to ensure consistent creation and verification of saved replies during testing.
author: Anshgrover23

title: Remove widget page object usage
description: ref: #584 ## Summary by CodeRabbit ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **Refactor** * Replaced widget page object abstractions with direct iframe interactions in end-to-end tests. * Introduced a new helper function to load and interact with the widget iframe. * Updated all tests to use Playwright locators and actions within the iframe. * Centralized widget loading logic for improved clarity and maintainability. * **Chores** * Removed obsolete test data and page object files related to widget testing. * **Bug Fixes** * Added a test ID to the loading spinner for improved test reliability.
author: Anshgrover23

title: remove base page object usage
description: - Simplified E2E tests by removing the BasePage object and redundant timeouts, using Page directly ref: #584 ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **Refactor** * Updated test page objects and tests to use Playwright’s native navigation and waiting methods instead of a shared base class. * Removed unnecessary abstraction to simplify test maintenance. * **Tests** * Adjusted end-to-end tests to directly utilize Playwright’s `page` object for navigation and state handling.
author: Anshgrover23

title: remove login page object usage
description: - Simplified E2E tests by removing the LoginPage class and redundant timeouts, using Page directly. ref: #584 ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **Tests** * Streamlined authentication test suite by removing page object abstractions and artificial waits. * Tests now use direct navigation and simplified assertions for login flows, including OTP input and redirection checks. * Removed the dedicated login page object, resulting in more concise and maintainable test code.
author: Anshgrover23

title: Refactor Conversations E2E Tests: Inline Locators and Remove Page Object
description: - Removed page object abstraction for conversations page - Replaced method calls with direct Playwright locator usage - Removed redundant waits and timeouts to speed up test execution - Added reusable `searchConversations()` helper - Ensured tests maintain existing coverage and viewport behavior ref: #584 ## Summary by CodeRabbit ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **Tests** * Streamlined end-to-end tests for conversations by removing reliance on page object classes. * Simplified navigation and interactions using direct Playwright commands and improved waiting strategies. * Maintained all test assertions and coverage while reducing redundant waits and complexity. * **Accessibility** * Improved accessibility by replacing test ID attributes with descriptive aria-labels on filter, date filter, and clear filters buttons. * Enhanced keyboard shortcut for search with better default prevention and enabled usage within form and editable fields.
author: Anshgrover23

title: fix auth test
description: ref: #117

title: feat: add migration job for encrypted to plaintext data conversion
description:
Summary:  add migration job for encrypted to plaintext data conversion

- Introduced a new job to migrate encrypted fields to plaintext columns across various database tables.
- Updated the package.json to include a new migration script command.
- Integrated the migration job into the existing job index for execution.

This change enhances data accessibility while maintaining security practices.

ref: #824 

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added a new script to migrate encrypted data to plaintext in the database. This process handles large datasets efficiently and provides logging of progress and errors. The script can be run via a new npm command.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
author: Anshgrover23

title: refactor: add plaintext columns for encrypted fields in database schema
description: Summary: Add plaintext columns for encrypted fields in database schema - Updated the database schema to include plaintext columns for various encrypted fields across multiple tables, including conversations, messages, and tool APIs. - Modified the API and data handling logic to support writing to both encrypted and plaintext columns. - Ensured that existing functionality remains intact while enhancing data accessibility. This change improves the handling of sensitive data while maintaining security practices. ref: #824 Attaching screenshot of passing test suite locally: ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * Added plaintext fields for message bodies, cleaned-up texts, conversation subjects, and authentication/access tokens across conversations, messages, tools, and Gmail support emails. * Plaintext values are now stored alongside encrypted fields for easier access and management. * **Bug Fixes** * Ensured consistent updating and synchronization of plaintext and encrypted fields when creating or updating records. * **Tests** * Updated test factories and assertions to verify the presence and correctness of new plaintext fields.
author: Anshgrover23

title: feat: add equity management feature in settings
description: Ref : #578 https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3be688a9-f478-4920-a961-f5add42b3cb5 ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * Added an "Equity" toggle in company settings, allowing administrators to enable or disable equity features. * Introduced a "Try equity" menu item in the dashboard sidebar for eligible administrators, with the ability to dismiss it. * When equity is enabled, additional equity management options become available in the dashboard. * **Improvements** * The equity settings form is now only visible when equity is enabled. * Updated sidebar and settings labels for clarity. * **Tests** * Enhanced end-to-end tests to cover enabling equity and verifying related UI changes.
author: Anshgrover23

title: refactor: consolidate equity flags into equity_enabled
description: Ref: #578 ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * Consolidated multiple equity-related company feature flags into a single "equityEnabled" flag, simplifying feature management and navigation. * Updated all relevant user interfaces and navigation to rely on the unified "equity" flag for displaying equity-related features. * **Bug Fixes** * Ensured all equity-related actions, permissions, and calculations consistently depend on the new "equityEnabled" flag. * Added authorization checks to restrict dividend and equity-related features when the equity flag is disabled. * **Tests** * Updated all backend, frontend, and end-to-end tests to use the "equityEnabled" flag, ensuring accurate test coverage for equity features. * **Chores** * Migrated company data and schemas to remove legacy equity flags and adopt the new unified flag. * Updated documentation to reflect the new equity feature flag usage.
author: Anshgrover23

title: remove use of companyUpdatesEnabled flag
description: https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f727e70f-0c0f-4f4c-a1eb-5ce07d0f57b7 Reference issue: #578 ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * Added tests to verify the visibility of the "Updates" sidebar link based on user roles and whether the company has investors. * **Bug Fixes** * Updated authorization for company updates to require the company to have investors instead of relying on a previous flag. * Adjusted feature flag logic so "company updates" features are only available when the company has investors. * **Chores** * Removed the obsolete "company updates enabled" flag from the database schema, seed data, and related code. * Updated test setups to ensure companies have investors when testing company updates functionality.
author: Anshgrover23

* **Chores**

  * Consolidated conversation metadata at the conversation level and removed unnecessary nesting in fixture files.
  * Deleted several outdated or redundant conversation fixture files.

* **Refactor**

author: Anshgrover23

title: Remove mailboxSlug from all frontend routes, components, and widget code for single-tenant migration
description:
### Summary:  
- Remove mailboxSlug from all frontend routes, components, and widget code for single-tenant migration

- [x] all test passed.
- This is part of the fifth sub-part of this issue: Ref: #489

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Updated dashboard and sidebar navigation to use simplified, mailbox-agnostic routes.
  * Introduced global dashboard and inbox views without mailbox-specific context.

* **Refactor**
  * Removed all dependencies on mailbox slugs across the application, streamlining API calls, component props, and routing.
  * Simplified component interfaces and context providers by eliminating mailbox-specific parameters.
  * Updated documentation and SDK usage to reflect the removal of mailbox slug requirements.
  * Restructured import paths to a more general category-based hierarchy, removing mailbox slug segments.

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Standardized URL paths and real-time event channels, reducing inconsistencies in navigation and notifications.
  * Fixed redirect targets after login and OAuth flows to use global routes instead of mailbox-specific paths.

* **Documentation**
  * Updated API and integration guides to remove references to mailbox slugs and clarify new usage patterns.
  * Removed mailboxSlug from React integration and API request examples.

* **Chores**
  * Cleaned up unused constants and test cases related to mailbox slugs.
  * Improved code organization by restructuring import paths and removing obsolete files.
  * Simplified widget initialization and authentication code by removing mailbox slug dependencies.
  * Adjusted end-to-end tests and page objects to use new simplified URL paths.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
author: Anshgrover23

title: refactor: rename mailboxId to unused_mailboxId
description:
### Summary:
- rename mailboxId to unused_mailboxId

- [x] all test passed.
- This is part of the fourth sub-part of this issue: Ref: #489


<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Refactor**
  * Removed all dependencies and references to mailbox identifiers across conversations, customers, tools, guides, FAQs, saved replies, websites, and related features.
  * Simplified data retrieval and filtering to operate without mailbox context, centralizing mailbox access where necessary.
  * Updated data models and APIs to use a unified, mailbox-agnostic approach throughout the platform.
  * Decoupled mailbox data fetching from nested queries, replacing with centralized mailbox retrieval calls.
  * Streamlined Slack integrations and AI-related functions by removing mailbox context from parameters and internal calls.

* **Tests**
  * Updated all test setups and assertions to remove mailbox-specific parameters and dependencies, streamlining test data creation and validation.

* **Chores**
  * Cleaned up environment variable handling and improved test environment setup for consistency.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
author: Anshgrover23

title: refactor: replace getMailboxById/getMailboxBySlug with getMailbox
description:

- Replace getMailboxById and getMailboxBySlug with a getMailbox function that just returns the first mailbox

- [x] all test passed.
- This is part of the third sub-part of this issue: Ref: #489


<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Refactor**
  * Standardized mailbox retrieval across the application by replacing various mailbox fetch methods with a single, streamlined approach.
  * Improved error handling and authentication checks in integration callback flows for GitHub and Slack.
  * Simplified and unified mailbox context usage in conversation assignment, merging, and update processes.
  * Enhanced maintainability by removing redundant code and consolidating mailbox-related logic.
  * Updated metadata API handling to remove mailbox slug dependencies, simplifying API interactions.
* **Tests**
  * Refined test setup for conversation routing to use shared user and mailbox instances, improving consistency and reducing redundancy.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
author: Anshgrover23

title: Remove mailbox switcher dropdown and mailboxes.list procedure
description:
- Removed the mailbox switcher dropdown from the sidebar UI
- Deleted the mailboxes.list TRPC procedure and all its usages
- Updated default/fallback mailbox logic to use the "helper" slug
- Cleaned up related tests and code

This is part of the second sub-part of this issue: Ref: #489 

before:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6cb1100b-4ed6-4868-b275-7f8b95bf70e8)


after:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ad0a4456-2181-49b9-8719-c9fd0f9d702f)


<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Refactor**
  * Simplified mailbox data fetching by removing the mailbox list query and dropdown menu for switching mailboxes in the sidebar.
  * Updated dashboard and mailbox page logic to fetch only the relevant mailbox directly, improving error handling and redirection.
  * Adjusted cache invalidation to target only the current mailbox after updates.
  * Modified mailbox page redirection to always use the first mailbox if available, or redirect to login if none exist.
  * Introduced a new method to retrieve all mailboxes for streamlined data access.

* **Tests**
  * Removed tests related to listing all mailboxes.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
author: Anshgrover23

title: chore: release screenpipe to official Homebrew/core
description:
---
name: chore: release screenpipe to official Homebrew/core
about: updates the docs to use official homebrew instead of repository tap
title: "chore: release screenpipe to official Homebrew/core"
labels: ''
assignees: ''

---

## description
release screenpipe to official Homebrew/core

Closes #614 
/claim #614 
related PR on homebrew https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/pull/196345

## type of change
- [x] documentation update


## checklist
- [x] MOST IMPORTANT: this PR will require less than 30 min to review, merge, and release to production and not crash in the hand of thousands of users
- [x] i have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/mediar-ai/screenpipe/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) file 
- [x] i have updated the documentation if necessary
- [x] my changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] i have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
author: Anshgrover23
